      • useDefaultCoordinateSystemOfDevice

        public void useDefaultCoordinateSystemOfDevice()
        After this method is called, the values returned by getX(), getY() and getZ() will be in the default coordinate system of the device. The coordinate system is defined relative to the screen of the device when the device is held in its default orientation. When a device is held in its default orientation, the X axis is horizontal and points to the right, the Y axis is vertical and points up, and the Z axis points toward the outside of the screen face. In this system, coordinates behind the screen have negative Z values.

      • useCoordinateSystemOfDisplay

        public void useCoordinateSystemOfDisplay()
        After this method is called, the values returned by getX(), getY() and getZ() will be in the current coordinate system of the display. If the current orientation is Configuration.ORIENTATION_PORTRAIT and the device is held in portrait orientation, or if the current orientation is Configuration.ORIENTATION_LANDSCAPE and the device is held in landscape orientation, the X axis is horizontal and points to the right, the Y axis is vertical and points up, and the Z axis points toward the outside of the gameState face. In this system, coordinates behind the gameState have negative Z values.

      • getX

        public float getX()
        Returns the X component of the vector read from the accelerometer.
        The vector will be in the current coordinate system of this AccelerometerValuesListener. Call useDefaultCoordinateSystemOfDevice() or useCoordinateSystemOfDisplay() to set the coordinate system to be used.
        Returns:
        X

      • getY

        public float getY()
        Returns the Y component of the vector read from the accelerometer.
        The vector will be in the current coordinate system of this AccelerometerValuesListener. Call useDefaultCoordinateSystemOfDevice() or useCoordinateSystemOfDisplay() to set the coordinate system to be used.
        Returns:
        Y

      • getZ

        public float getZ()
        Returns the Z component of the vector read from the accelerometer.
        The vector will be in the current coordinate system of this AccelerometerValuesListener. Call useDefaultCoordinateSystemOfDevice() or useCoordinateSystemOfDisplay() to set the coordinate system to be used.
        Returns:
        Z
